original: Bergström, Erhard Valentin, redaktör, Linköping, f. 4/1/97 i Eskilstuna. G. 25 m. Hilda Oljeqvist. Barn: Bengt £. 28, Ulf 32. — Res. t. Ital., Frankr., Island, Ryssl. m. fl. Medarb. i S’örmliands-’Po’Sten i Esikilstuna o. Katrineholms-Kurireni t. 19, redrsekr. i Hud|iksvalls Nyheter 19-22, red. f. Hudiksvalls-Posten 22-38, medarb. i Ostgöta Correspondenten i Linköp. sed. 38. Und. Hudiksvalls-tiden ordf. i N. Hälsinglands djurskyddsfören. o. N. Hälsinglands flygkl, sekr. i Fören. f. upprätthåll, av Lillfjärdens fågelliv, Trädgisällsk. o. Mod. fören. Skr.: Fågelliv i städernas parkdammar o. vattendrag (33). Sv. jägarförb. hed :ni. i guld, Gävieb. 1. jaktvifören. förtj :-bägare,
translated: Bergström, Erhard Valentin, editor, Linköping, b. January 4, 1897 in Eskilstuna. Married for 25 years to Hilda Oljeqvist. Children: Bengt b. 1928, Ulf b. 1932. Traveled to Italy, France, Iceland, Russia, and other places. Collaborated with Södermanlands-Posten in Eskilstuna and Katrineholms-Kuriren until 1919, secretary editor of Hudiksvalls Nyheter from 1919-1922, editor for Hudiksvalls-Posten from 1922-1938, and collaborated with Ostgöta Correspondenten in Linköping since 1938. During his time in Hudiksvall, he was the chairman of the North Hälsingland animal protection society and North Hälsingland aviation club, secretary of the society for maintaining Lillfjärden's bird life, Tree Companionship, and Modern Society. Writings: Birdlife in city park ponds and watercourses (1933). Honored by the Swedish hunting association with a gold medal, Gavle hunting society 1st hunting trophy.

structured.name: Erhard Valentin Bergström

memberOf.name: Society for Maintaining Lillfjärden's Bird Life
Society for Maintaining Lillfjärden's Bird Life

structured.description: Erhard Valentin Bergström was a Swedish editor and writer who was born on January 4, 1897, in Eskilstuna, Sweden. He was married for 25 years to Hilda Oljeqvist and had two children. Bergström was a well-traveled individual, having been to countries such as Italy, France, Iceland, Russia, and others. He worked with various newspapers, including Södermanlands-Posten, Katrineholms-Kuriren, Hudiksvalls Nyheter, and Hudiksvalls-Posten, where he served as an editor for over 15 years. Bergström was also a member of several organizations, including the North Hälsingland Animal Protection Society, the North Hälsingland Aviation Club, and the Society for Maintaining Lillfjärden's Bird Life. He wrote the book Birdlife in City Park Ponds and Watercourses in 1933 and received a gold medal from the Swedish Hunting Association and the 1st Hunting Trophy from the Gavle Hunting Society.
